metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6609 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin. A specially crafted database name could be used to run arbitrary PHP commands through the array export feature. All 4.6.x versions (prior to 4.6.4), 4.4.x versions (prior to 4.4.15.8), and 4.0.x versions (prior to 4.0.10.17) are affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6609` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.4+dfsg1-1').
